Problem:
Consider a scenario where the state of a system \\( z(t) \\) is governed by a complex function \\( z(t) = e^{At}z_0 \\), with \( A \) being a complex matrix. We inquire about the effects of applying a Fourier transform \\( F(z) \\) which modifies the system's frequency components.

If the Fourier transform \\( F(z) \\) is applied to the initial state \\( z_0 \\) and the system is then evolved according to \\( z(t) = e^{At}z_0 \\) without further modifications, will the state \\( z(T) \\) at time T match the evolution of the untransformed state \\( z_0 \\) at T under the same dynamics?
Explanation: The application of the Fourier transform alters the spectral composition of \\( z_0 \\), resulting in a modification of the initial conditions. Thus, the trajectory and final state \\( z(T) \\) of the system will be different from those of an untransformed state due to changes in the frequency-domain characteristics imposed by \\( F(z) \\).
